ImageDecoder.summary: The ImageDecoder interface of the provides a way to unpack and decode encoded image data.

ImageDecoderImageDecoder.summary: The ImageDecoder() constructor creates a new object which unpacks and decodes image data.

ImageDecoderTracks.summary: The tracks read-only property of the interface returns a list of the tracks in the encoded image data.

ImageDecoderCompleted.summary: The completed read-only property of the interface returns a promise that resolves once encoded data has finished buffering.
ImageDecoderCompleted.value: A {{jsxref("Promise")}} that resolves with {{jsxref("undefined")}} once is true.

ImageDecoderIsTypeSupported.summary: The ImageDecoder.isTypeSupported() static method checks if a given MIME type can be decoded by the user agent.
ImageDecoderIsTypeSupported.returns: A that resolves with a boolean value indicating whether images with a format of type can be decoded by the API.

ImageDecoderComplete.summary: The complete read-only property of the interface returns true if encoded data has completed buffering.
ImageDecoderComplete.value: A , true if buffering is complete.

ImageDecoderType.summary: The type read-only property of the interface reflects the MIME type configured during construction.
ImageDecoderType.value: A string containing the configured MIME type.

ImageDecoderDecode.summary: The decode() method of the interface enqueues a control message to decode the frame of an image.
ImageDecoderDecode.returns: A that resolves with an object containing the following members:

ImageDecoderClose.summary: The close() method of the interface ends all pending work and releases system resources.

ImageDecoderReset.summary: The reset() method of the interface aborts all pending decode() operations; rejecting all pending promises. All other state will be unchanged. Class methods can continue to be invoked after reset(). E.g., calling decode() after reset() is permitted.
